questions.question: Which of the following is the correct use of quotation marks?

choices.answer: 'what are you doing John'? said Mary
'Abdullah,' said Sonam, 'put that down!'
'You don't even go here, said Damien'
The old man said 'I can't do this anymore'.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the structure of a sentence?

choices.answer: A sentence must include a subject and a verb.
A sentence must include a subject, a verb and an object.
A sentence is anything with a capital letter at the beginning and a full st
A sentence must include a subject and an object.

questions.question: Select the complete sentence from below:

choices.answer: The scary, hairy and sometimes very merry spider.
A small village in the countryside, with a little stream running through it
The oldest tree in the world is over 4700 years old.
Michael's oldest and most loved teddy bear.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most definite (highest modality)?

choices.answer: Must
Can
May
Could

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of bracketing commas?

choices.answer: It was a Wednesday when the soldiers, carrying their guns, came into town.
It was a Wednesday when the, soldiers carrying their guns, came into town.
It was a Wednesday when the soldiers, carrying their guns came, into town.
It was a Wednesday, when the soldiers came, carrying their guns into town.

questions.question: Which of the following contains no spelling errors?

choices.answer: I wanted to go out cause it was raining and I like the rain.
I am better then George at tennis.
There were alot of people in the barn.
It's a really beautiful day outside today.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a prefix (letter/s that are added to the beginning of root words, to change the meaning)?

choices.answer: Sub
Ed
Semi
Dis

questions.question: Which prefix means half?

choices.answer: Sub
Re
Semi
Auto

questions.question: Suffixes tell us how the word is being used. Which of the following tells us the word is a way we can be?

choices.answer: Ive
Tion
Ly
Age

questions.question: Which of these is NOT useful to look at when skim reading a text?

choices.answer: All the body text
The beginning of each paragraph.
Key words, statistics and facts
The headings and subheadings

questions.question: Which of the following will MOST help you to improve your reading comprehension?

choices.answer: Completing reading comprehension assessments
Reading a range of different stories
Reading challenging texts and discussing them with others
Reading a range of different text types

questions.question: Which of the following descriptions creates a more effective image?

choices.answer: Outside it felt spooky and it was very dark.
Under the silent moon, a gnarled and ancient tree creaked in the wind.
There was a tall brown tree in the small dark yard in the dark cold night.
The back garden was creepy and there were lots of scary sounds.

questions.question: In the following poem, what is meant by 'queer'?

choices.answer: Strange
Lovely
Gay
Annoying

questions.question: In the following poem, why does the narrator stop in the woods?

choices.answer: He won't be seen
His house is in the village
To watch the snow falling
It's a mistake

questions.question: What happens at the end of the following poem?

choices.answer: The narrator stays in the woods.
The narrator doesn't want to leave, but he has responsibilities.
The narrator leaves.
The narrator must leave because the woods do not belong to him.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best way to improve your essay and short answer writing?

choices.answer: Complete all class work.
Complete all class work and receive feedback.
Read an essay.
Complete all class work and then make changes based on feedback.

questions.question: Which of the following places can you go to find resources for studying?

choices.answer: SEQTA, Wordflyers, Library, Teacher
SEQTA, friends, the shops
A book shop, your friends, other classes
SEQTA, your parents, your friends

questions.question: What order should you follow these steps in when you need help during work time?

choices.answer: Ask the teacher, check seqta, ask a friend.
Check the board, ask someone across the room, ask teacher
Think, check the board, ask your neighbour, ask the teacher
Ask the teacher, check the board, think

questions.question: What is wrong with the following paragraph?

choices.answer: Not enough commas.
There are no full stops.
The paragraph is not only one topic.
No capitals.

questions.question: Which of the following uses the correct tense?

choices.answer: I ran all the way to the shops and eat a sausage roll.
Yesterday I am going to dinner with my family.
Yesterday I was running late to school. This morning I was on time. Tomorro
Poppy left her friends behind and travels to the movies by herself.
